awd_titl_txt: NSFNET Connectivity for Mott Community College and          Baker College
awd_abstract_narration: Mott Community College and Baker College request support from NSF               for connection of their campuses to NSFNET.  MERIT is the                       midlevel network located in the state of Michigan that will                     provide operations and network information services.  It will                   give the colleges a 56 thousand bits per second connection to the               NSFNET, a high speed (1.5 - 45 million bits per second) National                Backbone network.                                                                                                                                               The colleges needs greater functionality and network speed to be                able to access supercomputers, libraries, and make file transfers               along with being able to implement a more reliable mail system.                 Students and faculty research will benefit from the link.  This                 is also a unique opportunity for the school to explore innovative               educational resources.***//
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
